concept.title: Notification preferences
concept.shortdesc: The following table lists the notification preferences for the HCL Sametime Connect Client and Sametime Embedded Client for Notes.

table.title: Notification Preferences - com.ibm.collaboration.realtime.alertmanager Â release 7.5.x and later

row.entry: String. Default is "SE". Four possible values, "NE", "NW", "SE", SW" (corresponding to northeast, northwest, southeast, southwest).
This stores one of four possible values, which indicate the corner of the user's screen where alert bubble will appear.
Stores the width in pixels of the alert bubble.
Stores the height in pixels of the alert bubble.
Stores the number of pixels to add as horizontal padding for the alert bubble to separate it from the edge of the desktop.
String value, "standard" = show standard OS window, "less" or others = show alert bubble for an alert
Determines whether to show the alert bubble or a standard OS window for an alert.
Boolean. TRUE = automatically close alert, FALSE = do not automatically close alert
Determines whether to automatically close an alert after it appears.
If alerts are set to automatically close, this is the delay amount in seconds before the alert is closed.
String value, "none" = no window animation, "slide" = animate using slide effect, and "fade" = animate using fade effect. The default value is "slide"
Specify the Alert bubble animation type.
The default value, whether to Bring the Popup window to front.
The default value, whether to Flash the taskbar to indicate new Popup window.
Determines whether to play sound when a new chat window opens.
For one-on-one chat, determines whether to play sound on chat response.
For multi-party chats, determines whether to play sound when there is an invitation to a multi-party chat.
For multi-party chats, determines whether to play sound on chat response.
Determines whether announcement events play a sound.
Determines whether Invitations to Sametime Classic online meeting play a sound.
Determines whether status alert events (Alert me When) play a sound.
Determines whether Location Awareness events play a sound.
Text string. Full path to a valid sound file of .WAV format.

The sound file that will play for one-on-one chat events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event. Do not use '\' as the file separator. Use '\\' or '/' instead. For example, com.ibm.collaboration.realtime.alertmanager/pref_event_0_soundfile=C:\\Documents\\sound.wav
Text string. Full path to a valid sound file of .WAV format.

The sound file that will play for Invitations to multi-party chat events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event. Do no't use '\' as the file separator. Use '\\' or '/' instead. For example, com.ibm.collaboration.realtime.alertmanager/pref_event_1_soundfile=C:\\Documents\\sound.wav
Text string. Full path to a valid sound file of .WAV format.

The sound file that will play for announcement events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event. Do not use '\' as the file separator. Use '\\' or '/' instead. For example, com.ibm.collaboration.realtime.alertmanager/pref_event_2_soundfile=C:\\Documents\\sound.wav .
Text string. Full path to a valid sound file of .WAV format.

The sound file that will play for Invitations to Sametime Classic online meeting events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event. Do not use '\' as the file separator. Use '\\' or '/' instead. For example, com.ibm.collaboration.realtime.alertmanager/pref_event_3_soundfile=C:\\Documents\\sound.wav
Text string. Full path to a valid sound file of .WAV format.

The sound file that will play for status alert events (Alert me When) events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event. Do not use '\' as the file separator. Use '\\' or '/' instead. For example, com.ibm.collaboration.realtime.alertmanager/pref_event_6_soundfile=C:\\Documents\\sound.wav.
Text string. Full path to a valid sound file of .WAV format.

The sound file that will play for Location Awareness events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event. Do not use '\' as the file separator. Use '\\' or '/' instead. For example, com.ibm.collaboration. realtime.alertmanager/ pref_event_7_soundfile= C:\\Documents\\ sound.wav.
For one-on-one chats, determines whether to bring chat window to front.
For one-on-one chats, determines whether to flash the taskbar to indicate new window.
For one-on-one chats, determines whether to show a system tray icon to indicate new message.
For one-on-one chats, determines whether to bring chat window to front on chat response.
For one-on-one chats, determines whether to flash the taskbar to indicate new message on chat response.
For one-on-one chats, determines, whether to show a system tray icon to indicate new message on chat response.
For invitations to multi-party chats, determines whether to bring invitation window to front.
For invitations to multi-party chats, determines whether to flash the taskbar to indicate new invitation.
For multi-party chats, determines whether to bring multi-party chat window to front on chat response.
For multi-party chats, determines whether to flash the taskbar on chat response.
For multi-party chats, determines whether to show a system tray icon on chat response.
For calls, determines whether to bring the invitation window to front.
For calls, determines whether to flash the taskbar to indicate new window.
For calls, specify the seconds before incoming invitation time out.
For Send Announcement dialog, determines whether to allow recipients to send responses.
For calls, determines whether to display incoming invitation.
Determines whether calendar events play a sound.
The sound file that will play for calendar events, if playing sounds is enabled for this event.
